title: Software Developer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Carleton University (Ottawa, ON)
Interview Descriptions: The average salary for a Food Service Manager is $54,380 per year in United States, which is 7% higher than the average How much do food service workers make in Canada?
Interview Questions: e salary for a Food Service Manager is $54,380 per year in United States, which is 7% higher than the averag

title: Postdoctoral Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Carleton University
Interview Descriptions: It was a remote process via Skype. that's it. It was a simple process. anyone who practices will do very well on their interview. I wish you all the best.
Interview Questions: Why did you apply for this position?

title: Social Media Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Carleton University
Interview Descriptions: Structured interview, approximately 10 questions. Heavily relies on using past examples. Ie tell me about a time xyz happened and what you did, how you stay organized, motivated, experience managing and growing social media channels.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time your quality assurance process failed and what you did.

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Carleton University
Interview Descriptions: No interview process really, but they match you to a professor with similar interests as your own. I had an amazing experience during my time as a Teaching Assistant. I got to do it three different times with three different professors and each time it was something I had interest in.
Interview Questions: Can you grade without being biased?

title: Web Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Carleton University in May 2022
Interview Descriptions: Virtual interview, virtual role. I applied through CUhire and had an interview. It was for the website for a professor. The it was pretty straight forward. They wanted to know my skill levels and availability, also how much I’m willing to commit.
Interview Questions: What are your technical skills? What are some of your favourite websites? What are you hoping to gain through this role?

title: Clerk Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Carleton University
Interview Descriptions: Two people during the interview that asked a total of 5 questions. Some questions were general interview questions and some were situational about working with a team and working with confidential information
Interview Questions: How would you manage having multiple tasks to complete within a short amount of time?

title: Faculty Member Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Carleton University (Ottawa, ON) in Apr 2021
Interview Descriptions:
Advert posted in October, I applied in November, and received notification  that I was longlisted in January.

Initial preliminary interview in February, followed by notification that I was shortlisted in March. Formal interview in April, followed by formal offer mid-April.

Very smooth process overall.
Interview Questions:
Where does your research fit within our department?

What courses can you teach?

title: Customer Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Carleton University
Interview Descriptions: Easy. Outgoing but still professional. 3 managers in total interviewing a group. We also did an activity to see how well we worked in teams. First round is an IQ test. Second round is group interview.
Interview Questions: Describe a time you helped a customer

title: Student Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Carleton University
Interview Descriptions: The interview lasted about 20 minutes. The questions were mostly about my motivation, prior teaching experiences, and the challenges previously experienced when I worked as a tutor. Since I already submitted my grades in the courses I wanted to tutor on no questions about those courses were asked. Overall the interview was casual and relaxed.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work as a tutor?

title: Ph D Candidate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Carleton University
Interview Descriptions: The interview was fairly relaxed. If you had previously reached out to your PI to set up your graduate degree, then the interview should be a breeze. Just be yourself and let your research do the talking.
Interview Questions: What do you see the result of your training culminating in?

title: Team Member Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Carleton University in Mar 2020
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very impersonal. Also note, there's a lot of nepotism in the Housing and Residence department.  Overall, a decent job undermined by poor management.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a time you resolved a conflict.

title: PASS Facilitator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Carleton University (Ottawa, ON)
Interview Descriptions: Online form with typical behavioral questions. If that went well a group interview followed where you had to do various activities in teams. If you get through that you get a final interview (panel) where you're asked a series of questions about yourself.
Interview Questions: Tell us about yourself.

title: Technical Support Analyst Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Carleton University
Interview Descriptions: Overall brief introductory segment to get familiar with me personally. Ran through my previous experience and education as highlighted on my resume and started to discuss key technical abilities I was bringing to the role. Whole interview took about 30 minutes.
Interview Questions: What tools I was familiar with

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Carleton University
Interview Descriptions: No interview. Based on online applications. Very easy to fill out but seniority based. Hard to usually land a position but once you do, it's pretty much secure provided you keep other criteria up.
Interview Questions: Previous experience.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 10 months. I interviewed at Carleton University (Ottawa, ON) in Aug 2019
Interview Descriptions: One lengthy interview that includes a discussion on salary, expenses, and weather.  Salary offers are too low and hardly cover tuition fees and need to work odd jobs to cover living expenses.
Interview Questions: Depending on each posting each department and labs have different questions.

title: Research Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Carleton University (Ottawa, ON) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: one in person interview that was perfect. The interview was an in person interview and there were three interviewer. it was so friendly and they were asking questions clearly. It took half an hour and they called me back to offer the position to me in one week.
Interview Questions: How my experience can help me for the job I applied for.

title: Senior Programmer Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Carleton University (Ottawa, ON) in Jul 2018
Interview Descriptions: It was a single round interview with a panel of a project manager, team lead and computer science professor. started with normal behavioral questions, technical and we wrapped up in about 20 minutes. The CS professor's questions were very typical with respect to Java and CS topics.
Interview Questions:
General past experience related questions.
Java/Pl-sql/sql questions

title: Web Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Carleton University (Ottawa, ON) in Feb 2018
Interview Descriptions: Fun team, good questions, honest about the role itself. I was plesently surprised by the team who interviewed me. I was expecting this to be a very white walled environment.
Interview Questions: What technologies are you proficient with?

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Carleton University in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: It was generally easy and quick. It could have been better if they had organised it a bit better. Overall it was a very good experience.It was generally easy and quick. It could have been better if they had organised it a bit better. Overall it was a very good experience.
Interview Questions: Explain your undergrad

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Carleton University (Ottawa, ON) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions:
There was a single in person Interview with three departmental professors prior to the job offer. Things discussed were: 
- Series of Knowledge based questions
- Review of previous course-work
- Review of relevant previous work experience
- Review of relevant skills
- Review of teaching interests
Interview Questions: Are you able to balance your own course-work with the additional demands of the position?

title: Engineering Coop Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Carleton University (Ottawa, ON) in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions: Interview with my professor about the coop project. Since I just taken his class, so we have known each other already. Then we have a pretty good chat with a few easy questions.
Interview Questions: What is your experience in protection case?

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Carleton University (Toronto, ON) in Jul 2017
Interview Descriptions: Online skype interview one to one with the supervisor. Then asked me for a visit and furhter presentation in a mass. After that had a lab demonstration and campus tour. Finally got the offer.
Interview Questions: First presentations on current work and majority of Questions asked from research I am doing

title: Undergraduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Carleton University (Ottawa, ON)
Interview Descriptions: No real interview. Just need to apply online and have good grades! Then meet your prof (but you already have the job, so it's not scary). Definitely recommend applying if you can.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Support Staff Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Carleton University (Ottawa, ON) in Sept 2016
Interview Descriptions: The interview was for support staff at CTS. The question were mainly related to technical knowledge regarding the job. They also asked situational and behavioral questions. The technical questions were pretty straight forward. The behavioral questions mainly focused on your ability to fit within the team.
Interview Questions: How would handle pressure/stressful situation on job?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Carleton University (Ottawa, ON) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: Very straightforward questions, very friendly staff. I felt like I could be myself and they were not too judgey or condescending.  Don't be nervous about interviewing with Carleton University-everyone is super accepting of all backgrounds, values, religion etc..
Interview Questions: Name a time when you handled multiple stressors at the same time

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Carleton University
Interview Descriptions: The first stage with only tests was extremely fast. Heard back from the company within a 2-day window. After the first interview and phone conversation however I did not hear back from them for 4 weeks and am still waiting.
Interview Questions:
Interview
1. Send in your CV and Cover Letter
2. You will have to fill in 3 online tests (cultural fit, situational strength test, logical reasoning test)
     This stage is overall not too hard
3. A strengt based telephone interview (typical questions)
    A case: you have 30 minutes to complete and afterwords they will call you and you have to give your recommendations. The case was about 2 seasonal beers you have to pick keeping…

title: Customer Service Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Carleton University
Interview Descriptions: Very easy but not a joke either, applied online, was contacted via email to choose an interview time, dressed business casual and the interview was with a manager and supervisor, was asked questions about what i would do in certain situations or about what kinds of qualities i have and to give examples of times when such and such happened
Interview Questions: Key questions will be about your knowledge about the university or the specific department you are working for, for example, "name two services you have used at Carleton and describe your experience."

title: Student Services Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Carleton University (Ottawa, ON) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: Interview was simple and straightforward...very professional yet friendly, welcoming and inviting. I immediately felt a connection with my interviewers, and they were very kind and enthusiastic about my being there. The main interviewer was very relaxed and I did not feel any stress at all, unlike how I have felt in previous interviews.
Interview Questions: What can you bring to our team?

title: Learning Center Scholar Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Carleton University (Ottawa, ON) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: Standard in-person interview with a panel of two: learning center coordinator and former scholar. Questions were predictable, relating to your past experiences, challenges and unique strengths. They wrote down everything I said. No impromptu questions were asked.
Interview Questions: what is your unique strength?

title: SPA Welcome Partner Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Carleton University (Ottawa, ON) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: Every week a casting call is held on Fridays between 1 - 4pm. If you submit a resume chances are they will invite you to this. SHOW UP EARLY! (Before 1pm) to secure one of their few interview spots. This is one of the only places where you are guaranteed an interview (at least)! Once that interview is completed they may put you through to another interview right away. After that they will call you back after they meet on the following Monday to discuss hiring, if they like you. The final step is a final interview and completing a quiz on Brookstreet and the department you are applying for.
Interview Questions: Why Brookstreet? What can you tell us about Brookstreet? Can you tell us about a time when you went above and beyond for a customer? What charities does Brookstreet support? Have you ever had a situation where an employee was dishonest?

title: Game Development Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Carleton University (Ottawa, ON) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: Process is 3 interviews with your project coordinator. The game is discussed with the consumer of the game, then there is a funding meeting, then finally a project start meeting, at which point the job begins.
Interview Questions: Are you okay with Carleton University using the work you have done, with future students

title: Customer Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Carleton University (Ottawa, ON) in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: First invited to a group interview (12-16 people) that was about 2 hours long. Asked various questions to the group with the chance to contribute answers. Presented information about the job. Then selected for a one on one personal interview. asked situational questions.
Interview Questions: If this certain scenario happened, what would you do?

title: Admission Services Staff Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Carleton University (Ottawa, ON) in Jul 2014
Interview Descriptions:
Basically three rounds:
1. Apply through HR, speak with HR rep through email/phone answering basic background questions.
2. Phone interview/emails with a senior staff member from the department answering some questions about why you want to do this job etc.
3. In person interview with panel of staff from department, pretty extensive (1hr).
Interview Questions:
Why do you want to do this job?
Tell us what you know about Carleton?
List all of Carleton's programs.
Tell us about your favorite service on campus and why you like it.

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Carleton University
Interview Descriptions: Asked about previous jobs, skills I learned and able to do the requirements asked from the job posting. They went through my entire resume and asked about what I did and skills I developed. In addition, how I deal with conflict with customers and staff members and give them an example I faced with.
Interview Questions: Nothing unexpected

title: Network Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Carleton University
Interview Descriptions: Made it seem like a normal conversation. Assured me that everyone has to get a long. Talked about past times and fun experiences.
Interview Questions: No hard technical questions. The work could be done by anybody with computer skills but was mostly hands on and required organization.

title: Lifeguard Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Carleton University (Ottawa, ON) in Sept 2013
Interview Descriptions: Hiring process was quick and intense.  Within one week and a half of accepting applications, all candidates were already put through a preliminary round of testing.  First round is practical, in a pool.  All candidates do fitness tests, and first aid scenarios in the pool.  After this round, selected candidates go in for a one-on-one interview.  From there, the group of new hires is selected.
Interview Questions: If you could compare your personality to the qualities of an animal, what animal would you choose and why?

title: Applications Specialist  Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Carleton University (Ottawa, ON) in Jan 2009
Interview Descriptions: It was easy.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself
